title: EU seals Lagarde’s ECB appointment
text:
Christine Lagarde will success Mario Draghi | Eric Baradat/AFP via Getty Images EU seals Lagarde’s ECB appointment She will serve an 8-year term as president.

EU leaders formally appointed Christine Lagarde Friday to become European Central Bank president on November 1.

The former International Monetary Fund boss and French finance minister will serve a nonrenewable eight-year term as president, succeeding Mario Draghi.

Lagarde tweeted her “sincere thanks to European leaders.” She said, “It is an honour to succeed Mario Draghi. I am looking forward to working with the ECB’s talented staff to keep euro area prices stable and banks safe.”

Government leaders officially completed the ECB selection process during a summit meeting in Brussels. Their approval was certain after the same group picked her in July, as part of a package of names for top positions such as presidents of the European Commission and Council. Since then, she received positive opinions from the Parliament and the ECB itself.

Draghi will oversee one more monetary policy meeting of eurozone central bankers on October 24 before he passes the baton on to Lagarde.
